page.title: 12Local History in Aboyne
page.content: {Transport}in{Local History:} Aboyne has changed considerably over the past century with marked changes in the road systems. The old turnpike used to take a bend round by the old Kirkton of Aboyne and the loch and enter Aboyne above the present level of the old railway. A stretch of the old highway runs in front of the Aboyne Castle and can still be seen today. Here the road took a sharp leftward bend and took us down to the Station square. The present day Boat Inn, so called because of the{ferry} crossing which operated in front of it around 1800 has changed dramatically within living memory. It is however still in the same building, although it has been modernised quite a bit. There have been three{bridges}over the river, all built where the present day one stands outside the Boat Inn.
